Class DateTime

  • java.lang.Object
    • DateTime
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class DateTime
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class representing a date and a time
    Version:
    0.3, 10/12/2016
    Author:
    Krystof Spiller
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a DateTime object in a format "day/month/year hour:minute:second" and for day, month and time it always keeps two characters (e.g. 07/09/2016 12:05:29).

      • set

        public void set(int day,
                int month,
                int year)
        Sets the day, month and year for the DateTime object based on the arguments and sets the hour, minute a second to zero. Processes the arguments: Makes an absolute value of the year argument. Month is limited from 1 to 12. Day is limited from 1 to maximum day in a month.
        Parameters:
        day - the day as an integer
        month - the month as an integer
        year - the year as an integer

      • set

        public void set(int day,
                java.lang.String monthName,
                int year)
        Calls the three-argument set method above after the month name is converted to month number.
        Parameters:
        day - the day as an integer
        monthName - the month name as a String
        year - the year as an integer

      • set

        public void set(int day,
                int month,
                int year,
                int hour,
                int minute,
                int second)
        Calls the three-argument set method with integers and sets hour, minute and second. Processes the arguments: Hour is limited from 0 to 23. Minute and second is limited from 0 to 59.
        Parameters:
        day - the day as an integer
        month - the month as an integer
        year - the year as an integer
        hour - the hour as an integer
        minute - the minute as an integer
        second - the second as an integer

      • isLeapYear

        public boolean isLeapYear()
        Returns:
        whether the year is leap year (true) or not (false)

      • stepForwardOneDay

        public void stepForwardOneDay()
        Steps forward by one day. Takes care of stepping on next month or next year.

      • stepForward

        public void stepForward(int days)
        Steps forward by number of days specified in the argument by calling the stepForwardOneDay method in a loop
        Parameters:
        days - number of days the DateTime steps forward as an integer

      • numberOfDaysInMonth

        public int numberOfDaysInMonth()

        Calculates the number of years between a given date in the argument and this date
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the number of years between this DateTime and other DateTime specified in the argument.

        public DateTime dateTimeBetween(DateTime other)
        Calculates the time between a given date in the argument and this date
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the DateTime object representing the time between this and other DateTime

      • toArray

        public int[] toArray()
        Returns values in a format appropriate for calculation.
        Returns:
        an array of six integers, representing years, months, days, hours, minutes and seconds

      • addDateTime

        public void addDateTime(DateTime other)
        Adds to this DateTime an other DateTime specified in the argument.
        Parameters:

      • isBefore

        public boolean isBefore(DateTime other)
        Compares this DateTime with the DateTime specified in the argument and returns if it's before or not.
        Parameters:
        other - the date and time which is compared to this object's date and time
        Returns:
        if the other DateTime specified in the argument is before this DateTime (true) or not (false)

      • copy

        public DateTime copy()
        Returns:
        the copy of this DateTime

      • convertToMonthNumber

        public static int convertToMonthNumber(java.lang.String monthName)
        Parameters:
        monthName - the month name as a String
        Returns:
        the number of the month as an integer based on the month name specified in the argument

      • parse

        public static DateTime parse(java.lang.String string)
        Parses the string specified in the argument. First splits the string in the argument by every dot, slash, hyphen, space or underscore. Then it checks, if the string has been split to three parts and all the parts contain only numbers. If this condition is true, then it parses the individual parts to day, month and year. If these variables are within their respective limits with their values, the DateTieme object is created and returned.
        Parameters:
        string - the string which is parsed
        Returns:
        the DateTime object if the string could be parsed, otherwise returns null

      • now

        public static DateTime now()
        Returns:
        the DateTime object with current date and time.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Comparing objects to one another.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - an Object for comparison
        Returns:
        if the objects equal to each other

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a DateTime object in a format "day/month/year hour:minute:second" and for day, month and time it always keeps two characters (e.g. 07/09/2016 12:05:29).
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        if the objects equal to each other
